thread.title: E-commerce company adds more jobs in Cincinnati area
thread.title_full: E-commerce company adds more jobs in Cincinnati area

title: E-commerce company adds more jobs in Cincinnati area
text:
Suburban Cincinnati-based TradeGlobal to add 800 temporary holiday jobs, 300 full-time 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/25/15 4:30 am EDT - Updated: 10/25/15 4:30 am EDT 
CINCINNATI â€” A suburban Cincinnati-based firm with connections to several globally recognized fashion brands is planning to add more jobs in the Cincinnati area starting this holiday season. 
The Cincinnati Enquirer reports ( http://cin.ci/1hUkJSs ) TradeGlobal will add 800 temporary jobs over the holidays and another 300 full-time positions beginning next year. 
The temporary jobs include customer service and warehouse positions. Officials say permanent jobs are likely in website development and digital marketing. 
The job boom follows the West Chester Township company's acquisition by Singapore Post Limited, a southeast Asian firm spanning 15 countries. 
TradeGlobal provides e-commerce solutions for retailers such as Versace, Calvin Klein, Puma and more. 
CEO Dave Eckley says TradeGlobal views the acquisition as an opportunity to bring new resources and innovations to the company's clients. 
Information from: The Cincinnati Enquirer, http://www.enquirer.com
